product: Hero Growler 26T MTB Hybrid Geared Cycle | 21 Speed Shimano Gears with Front Suspension and Dual disc Brakes | Ideal Age 1...
title:
4.0 out of 5 stars
good and sturdy cycle easy to assemble - not shimano but sunrun gears sprandom disc
body:
Cycle was as much taller than expected. I was comparing with another 26" hero sprint celero and its much higher, hero howler 29" and this one seems to have same frame so it slopes more steeper than celero so the height increase. I am 5.5' and still just about managed to touch my feet at lowest height seat and handle bar just giving space for mudguard and reflector.I was very disappointed to see a random chineese brand sunrun as replacement for the shimano gears as presented in the pictures and mentioned in specs. Given that this cycle was priced 11,700 only 700 than market price of hero howler disappointing to see such cheap brands in final delivery.However though I wanted to return the cycle just for this I decided to keep it as the sunrun gears and sprandom disk brakes were ok for the job.The gears need slight alignment as +3 in front slips to second gear in front. back was alligned ok. the disc brakes also needed some tuning but works. Be carefun to balance the wheel disk  between the disc calipers when tightening the wheel hub or it can wear out one side and wheel will not be smooth.The gear and disc brake cables were thin and metal a little flimsy. Hoping it will last a few years on good maintenance. Only issue is the wheel  hub and spoke at center of back wheel was not balanced and was wobbly slightly and front wheel was tight due to disc balance. Fixef after adjusting hub.  I will probably give it for a refitment after a months use.giving 4star as its not shimano gears and discs. Otherwise a great buy though I see some ppl got it for 10k last year
